recipe.title: How to Make Wasabi Cocktail Sauce

procedure.summary: Combine the ketchup, horseradish, soy sauce, and vinegar in a bowl.
procedure.description: Begin by adding 1 cup (235 grams) of ketchup, 2 US tbsp (1.0  fl oz) of horseradish, 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of soy sauce, and 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of rice wine vinegar into a medium-size mixing bowl. Stir the ingredients together.

procedure.summary: Add the wasabi paste to your mixture and whisk until it’s smooth.
procedure.description: Before you serve your sauce, make sure that the wasabi paste is thoroughly mixed with the other ingredients. The sauce should be free from clumps. You can always modify the amount of wasabi paste to fit your taste. If you added too much wasabi paste, add 1 tbsp (14.7 grams) of ketchup at a time to help even out the flavor.

Although this sauce would be great with any seafood dish, it is recommended that you serve it with shrimp. There is no need to chill the sauce before you serve it and you can dip your shrimp directly into the sauce.

procedure.summary: Store any leftover sauce in the fridge for up to a week.
procedure.description: Make sure your sauce is covered before you put it in the fridge. An airtight container works best if you are planning to store your sauce for the better part of a week. If you plan to use the sauce within a few days, a piece of plastic wrap covering the bowl will work.
